title: France enshrines 'freedom' to abortion in Constitution, in world first
summary: A joint session of Parliament voted to adopt a constitutional reform to protect the 'freedom of women to voluntarily terminate a pregnancy, which is guaranteed.'

title: Supreme Court overturns Trump's disqualification by states from Republican primaries
summary: The justices awarded Donald Trump another victory on the eve of Super Tuesday, when Republicans vote to nominate their candidates in 15 states.

title: Israel-Hamas war: 'Grounds to believe' rapes committed during October 7 attacks
summary: As the UN faced criticism for reacting too slowly to the rapes and sexual violence that Israel accuses Hamas of committing on October 7, experts visited Israel and the West Bank for two and a half weeks in early February.

title: EU to ban single-use plastic packaging in cafes from 2030
summary: The EU's 27 nations and lawmakers have reached a consensus on a draft text on Monday, which establishes a target of reducing packaging waste in the bloc by five percent by 2030, in comparison to the levels recorded in 2018.

title: 'Mbappé's change of status at PSG is so sudden that it's hard not to see it as the club's desire to retaliate'
summary: In his column, Jérome Latta sees the deteriorating relationship between Kylian Mbappé and Paris-Saint-Germain as a lose-lose game. Particularly in the run-up to the Champions League match against Real Sociedad on Tuesday.

title: Warsaw's Karma bar, nocturnal HQ of Belarusian dissidents in exile
summary: This trendy bar in the Polish capital is home to many young activists who have fled neighboring authoritarian countries. Top of the list is Belarus, where a sham election has just been held.

title: Former Twitter execs sue Musk, X, for over $128 million in severance
summary: Ex Twitter CEO, CFO, legal chief, and general counsel, who led the company during the hostile takeover, say Elon Musk fired them citing gross negligence and willful misconduct, which they deny. Musk said at the time they were fired for cause – and that he didn’t have to pay severance.

title: In Rafah, Gazans struggle to survive under the constant threat of Israeli attacks
summary: Stuck at the still-closed Egyptian border, more than a million Palestinians barely survive, traumatized, in an area of around 64 square kilometers.

title: Iran's conservatives unsurprisingly dominate elections, amid record-low turnout
summary: The main coalition of reformist parties, the Reform Front, had said it would not take part in 'meaningless, non-competitive and ineffective elections.'

title: EU fines Apple €1.8 billion for antitrust violations in music streaming
summary: The European Commission ruled that Apple prevented music streaming services from informing users about subscription options outside of its App Store.

title: Deprived of manpower, Israeli kibbutzim turn to French Jewish scouts
summary: Members of the long-standing group bringing together France's Jewish youth are setting off to lend a hand on Israeli farmlands, which have experienced a labor shortage since the October 7 attacks.

title: Russia's Luftwaffe eavesdropping scandal embarrasses Berlin
summary: The opposition is calling for the German chancellor to explain himself after Moscow broadcast a discussion between senior German air force officers on the possibility of supplying Ukraine with Taurus cruise missiles.

title: Why Israel attacks the UN agency for Palestinian refugees
summary: Israel accused 12 UNRWA members of participating in the October 7, 2023 attack. These allegations, which have yet to be substantiated, threaten to bring down an organization that plays a crucial humanitarian role in Gaza.

title: European Commission unveils ambitious defense industry strategy
summary: Brussels is proposing to co-finance joint arms acquisitions by member states and the modernization of factories in the sector, as well as new tools to strengthen companies in the face of their American competitors.

title: Haiti declares a curfew after hundreds of inmates fleed the main prison
summary: The 72-hour state of emergency went into immediate effect as the government said it would set out to find the criminals that it reported escaped from the prison. At least nine people have been killed since Thursday.

title: Olga Smirnova, former Bolshoi Ballet star: 'I won't return to a Russia without freedom'
summary: The former soloist at the prestigious Moscow ballet company, who left her country shortly after the start of the Russian invasion of Ukraine, lives exile in Amsterdam.

title: US presidential election: Nikki Haley wins her first primary in the District of Columbia
summary: Washington is one of the most heavily Democratic jurisdictions in the nation, with only about 23,000 registered Republicans in the city.

title: The first time Le Monde wrote SOB
summary: The insult, used against Vladimir Putin by Joe Biden, first appeared in the newspaper on April 14, 1951, after it was uttered by Republican Senator Joseph McCarthy.

title: Rugby: France beats Great Britain to claim Los Angeles Sevens men's title
summary: New Zealand also easily overpowered Australia to win their second back-to-back women's title on Sunday.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Israel and UN trade allegations of 'terrorism,' torture
summary: Israel recalled its ambassador to the UN on Monday, March 4, as tensions erupted over the handling of allegations of sexual assault by Hamas militants during the October 7 attacks.

title: VP Harris met with key Israeli official amid White House push for Gaza cease-fire
summary: White House officials said Benny Gantz, a centrist political rival of Netanyahu, requested the meeting and that the Democratic administration believed it was important that Harris sit down with the prominent Israeli official despite Netanyahu's objections.

title: Jack Teixeira pleads guilty to leaking American military secrets
summary: The member of the Massachusetts Air National Guard agreed to a sentence of 17 years in prison, according to the plea agreement.

title: Sex at the office: Why the boss can't flirt anymore
summary: While romantic relationships are accepted between colleagues of equal rank, they are frowned upon when one partner is a member of the company hierarchy, due to suspicions of coercion.

title: Paris's Orly airport kicks off vast redevelopment project to reduce carbon emissions
summary: The airport operator is undertaking a comprehensive revamp of the organization and access points to the Paris region airport, with the goal of attaining "zero net emissions on the ground by 2030," i.e., excluding aircraft take-off and landing.

title: Padel craze is sweeping across France: 'It's a far cry from the hushed world of tennis'
summary: Somewhere between tennis and squash, this sport is fast becoming a hit and breathing new life into some struggling tennis clubs, which are transforming their green courts into blue ones.
